text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- The opposition Smallholders' Party proposed in parliament to reintroduce capital punishment.
- There is still no candidate for the post of president of the State Audit Office.
- The European Union's Phare programme supports Hungarian investments for environmental protection by one billion forints.
- The capital Budapest began a four-year development plan financed from the city's privatisation revenues.
- Hungary and Estonia signed an agreement on joint fight against drugs, terrorism and organised crime.
